channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12891] Parallel execution for Hbck checkRegionConsistency
item.description: We have a lot of regions on our cluster ~500k and noticed that hbck took quite some time in checkAndFixConsistency(). Dave Latham patched our cluster to do this check in parallel to speed things up. I'll attach the patch.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: The 98 patch will work with 1.x and 0.98.

If there're many regions to check, there would be considerable load on master, right ?
Should there be some limit on the number of concurrent threads ?
This patch simply adds an additional case to uses the existing executor service thread pool. It has a default max of 50 threads and can be configured to something different.
Alright.

Reattaching refreshed trunk patch for precommit.

I applied the 0.98 patch and ran the hbck unit tests, all passed.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12694244/HBASE-12891.patch
against master branch at commit 74adb11f4c504abbb6a52de72b53883ad7b952b4.

Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

Ok for branch-1.0 Enis Soztutar ? Going to commit this everywhere else shortly unless objection.
Pushed to 0.98, branch-1, and master.
Patch looks good, but should not we rethrow the exception, rather than just printing a log for it. It changes the behavior for hbck where it used to throw the exception.

should not we rethrow the exception, rather than just printing a log for it. It changes the behavior for hbck where it used to throw the exception.

I think if that's a concern we could make the change in a quick followup

Reopened for addendum. Attaching what I had in mind (although a bit ugly).

Rethrowing the exception is important IMO since if we cannot get the information for a subset of regions, and based on that do some fixes later on in the hbck execution it might be disastrous. Let's be safe instead.

With addendum TestHBaseFsck fails now. tableInfos is not thread safe. I think we should revert the patch until we fix it.

churro morales, Dave Latham you mind addressing the concurrency issues? I think this is still useful.
Moved out to 0.98.12

The TableInfo.regionsFromMeta is a ArrayList that cannot be traversed thread-safe concurrently.

Using CopyOnWriteArrayList is not perf-effective, as the checkRegionConsistency() populates and sorts the TableInfo.regionsFromMeta.

The attached V2 patch tries to use Collections.synchronizedList() method for synchronizing the TableInfo.regionsFromMeta ArrayList.

Attached the V2 patch for master, it attempts to solve the thread-safe issue. Comparing to V1 patch and addendum, it adds

  • parallel execution on replicas (churro morales, not sure why you did not parallelize the execution on replicas in your V1 patch)
  • handle the TableInfo.regionsFromMeta traversing on thread-safe
Patch v2 lgtm.

Checked the https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13428//artifact/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-server.html and did not see any new warnings from HBaseFsck.java (the only file modified).

Thanks, Stephen, for jumping in, identifying the concurrency problem and the new patch.

Churro is out right now and we've been up to some other things.

I reviewed the patch, and I'd like to propose an alternative that separates the lazy load of regionsFromMeta into a synchronized method and leaves use of it alone. I've attached that as HBASE-12891-v3.patch
